info.description:
üöÄ **OSM Admin API** - Complete Odoo Server Management Solution


## üîë Key Features

### üèóÔ∏è **Instance Management**
- üì¶ Install new Odoo instances with custom configurations
- üîÑ Clone existing instances with addons and data
- üóëÔ∏è Safely remove instances with database options
- ‚öôÔ∏è Manage instance configurations and services

### üë• **User Management**
- üë§ Manage Odoo users (create, suspend, delete, password reset)
- üîê Linux system user management
- üé≠ User impersonation for support

### üåê **Domain & Proxy Management**
- üåç Add/remove custom domains for instances
- üîí SSL certificate management
- ‚ö° Advanced proxy configuration (Nginx/Traefik)

### üíæ **Backup & Recovery**
- üíæ Automated backup scheduling
- üì• Manual backup creation and download
- üîÑ Database restoration with target options
- ‚è∞ Cron-based automated backups

### üîß **Development Tools**
- üì¶ Python package management (pip)
- üîó GitHub addon integration
- üîÑ Webhook-based automatic updates

### üìä **Monitoring & Logs**
- üìà System metrics and performance monitoring
- üìã Installation and service logs
- üîç PostgreSQL connection monitoring

### üß© **Odoo Apps Management**
- List all Odoo apps (base, custom, GitHub addons) for any Odoo instance
- Install, upgrade, uninstall, and update the apps list for any instance
- Filter apps by state (installed, uninstalled, to_upgrade, etc.)
- See detailed metadata for each app, including dependencies and source

### üè¢ **Multi-Tenant Solution**
- All endpoints require both a `user` (Linux user/instance owner) and a `website` (project/domain) to uniquely identify the Odoo instance
- Manage multiple Odoo instances on a single server via a unified API

## üîê Authentication
All endpoints require an API key for authentication.
Set the `X-API-Key` header with your API key for all requests.

## üß™ Testing
You can try out endpoints directly from this docs page.
Use the scheme selector to switch between HTTP and HTTPS as needed.

## üìö Documentation
Each endpoint includes detailed parameter descriptions and response examples.
Required fields are clearly marked, and optional fields are explained.
info.title: OSM Admin API by GTS

get.description: Lists all installed Odoo apps for a given user and website using Odoo shell. Requires user and website.

parameters.description: Filter by app state (installed, uninstalled, to_upgrade, etc.)
parameters.name: filter

500.description: Internal server or Odoo shell error

delete.description: Uninstalls a specific Odoo app for a given user and website using Odoo shell. Requires user, website, and app_name.

200.description: Standard response envelope with uninstall result" example({"id":"123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000","timestamp":"2024-07-01T12:00:00Z","status":"success","message":"App uninstall triggered successfully","app":"sale_management","output":"{...}"})

500.description: Internal server or Odoo shell error

post.description: Installs a specific Odoo app for a given user and website using Odoo shell. Requires user, website, and app_name.

200.description: Standard response envelope with install result" example({"id":"123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000","timestamp":"2024-07-01T12:00:00Z","status":"success","message":"App install triggered successfully","app":"sale_management","output":"{...}"})

500.description: Internal server or Odoo shell error

post.description: Triggers a refresh of the available apps list from Odoo for a given user and website using Odoo shell. Requires user and website.

200.description: Standard response envelope with update result" example({"id":"123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000","timestamp":"2024-07-01T12:00:00Z","status":"success","message":"Apps list update triggered successfully","output":"{...}"})

500.description: Internal server or Odoo shell error

post.description: Triggers an upgrade for a specific Odoo app on a given user and website using Odoo shell. Requires user, website, and app_name.

200.description: Standard response envelope with upgrade result" example({"id":"123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000","timestamp":"2024-07-01T12:00:00Z","status":"success","message":"App upgrade triggered successfully","app":"sale_management","output":"{...}"})

400.description: Standard error envelope" example({"id":"123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000","timestamp":"2024-07-01T12:00:00Z","status":"error","message":"Missing user, website, or app_name parameter"})

500.description: Internal server or Odoo shell error

post.description:
üîß Configure global S3 remote backup for all instances

**What this does:**
- Sets up global S3 remote backup configuration
- Applies to all instances unless overridden by user/instance config
- Configures bucket, credentials, and retention settings

**Use cases:**
- Set up organization-wide cloud backup storage
- Configure company-wide disaster recovery
- Enable global backup policy

200.description: Successfully configured global S3 remote backup

post.description:
üîß Configure global SFTP remote backup for all instances

**What this does:**
- Sets up global SFTP remote backup configuration
- Applies to all instances unless overridden by user/instance config
- Configures server, credentials, and retention settings

**Use cases:**
- Set up organization-wide remote server backup storage
- Configure company-wide secure off-site backups
- Enable global backup policy

200.description: Successfully configured global SFTP remote backup

post.description:
üîß Configure S3 remote backup for an Odoo instance

**What this does:**
- Sets up S3 remote backup configuration
- Configures bucket, credentials, and retention settings
- Enables automatic upload of backups to S3

**Configuration options:**
- Bucket name and region
- Access key and secret key
- Optional custom endpoint (for S3-compatible services)
- Retention period and encryption settings

**Use cases:**
- Set up cloud backup storage
- Configure disaster recovery
- Enable off-site backup replication

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance
parameters.name: user

post.description:
üîß Configure SFTP remote backup for an Odoo instance

**What this does:**
- Sets up SFTP remote backup configuration
- Configures server, credentials, and retention settings
- Enables automatic upload of backups to SFTP server

**Configuration options:**
- SFTP server host and port
- Username and password or private key
- Remote directory path
- Retention period settings

**Use cases:**
- Set up remote server backup storage
- Configure secure off-site backups
- Enable backup replication to remote servers

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance
parameters.name: user

post.description:
üîß Configure S3 remote backup for a specific user's instances

**What this does:**
- Sets up user-scoped S3 remote backup configuration
- Applies to all instances of the specified user
- Overrides global config for this user

**Use cases:**
- Set up user-specific cloud backup storage
- Configure user-specific disaster recovery
- Override global backup policy for specific users

200.description: Successfully configured user S3 remote backup

post.description:
üîß Configure SFTP remote backup for a specific user's instances

**What this does:**
- Sets up user-scoped SFTP remote backup configuration
- Applies to all instances of the specified user
- Overrides global config for this user

**Use cases:**
- Set up user-specific remote server backup storage
- Configure user-specific secure off-site backups
- Override global backup policy for specific users

200.description: Successfully configured user SFTP remote backup

post.description:
üíæ Create a new backup of an Odoo instance

**What this does:**
- Creates a complete backup of the specified Odoo instance
- Includes database, filestore, and configuration files
- Can be immediate or scheduled for later execution
- Optionally sets up automated backup scheduling

**Backup types:**
- Immediate: Creates backup right away
- Scheduled: Sets up cron job for automated backups
- Manual: One-time backup without scheduling

**Use cases:**
- Pre-upgrade safety backup
- Disaster recovery preparation
- Data migration preparation
- Compliance requirements

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** Large instances may take significant time to backup

delete.description:
üóëÔ∏è Permanently remove a backup file

**What this does:**
- Permanently deletes the specified backup file
- Frees up storage space
- Removes backup from the backup index
- This action is irreversible

**Use cases:**
- Storage space management
- Old backup cleanup
- Compliance requirements
- Backup rotation

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** This action is permanent and cannot be undone

post.description:
üîß Disable remote backup for an Odoo instance

**What this does:**
- Disables remote backup functionality
- Keeps local backups intact
- Removes remote backup configuration

**Use cases:**
- Stop remote backup uploads
- Switch to local-only backups
- Troubleshoot remote backup issues

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance
parameters.name: user

get.description:
‚¨áÔ∏è Download a backup file for local storage or transfer

**What this does:**
- Streams the specified backup file for download
- Provides direct access to backup files
- Supports large file downloads with proper streaming
- Validates file existence before download

**Download options:**
- Direct download: Streams file to client
- Resume support: Handles interrupted downloads
- Progress tracking: Shows download progress

**Use cases:**
- Offsite backup storage
- Local backup archives
- Data migration between servers
- Compliance requirements

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Large backup files may take time to download

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance (e.g., 'myuser')
parameters.name: user

get.description:
üì¶ Retrieve backup files for Odoo instances

**What this does:**
- Lists all available backup files based on filter criteria
- Supports filtering by user and/or website
- Returns backup metadata including size, creation date, and status

**Filter options:**
- No parameters: Returns all backups for all users and instances
- User only: Returns all backups for all instances of that user
- User + Website: Returns backups for that specific instance

**Use cases:**
- Backup inventory management
- Disaster recovery planning
- Storage optimization
- Compliance auditing

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance (e.g., 'myuser')
parameters.name: user

500.description: Server error or backup system failure

get.description:
üîß Get the effective remote backup configuration for an instance

**What this does:**
- Returns the effective remote backup configuration
- Shows which configuration level is being used (global/user/instance)
- Implements hierarchy: instance > user > global

**Use cases:**
- Check which remote backup config is active for an instance
- Debug remote backup configuration issues
- Understand configuration inheritance

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance
parameters.name: user

200.description: Successfully retrieved effective remote backup configuration

get.description:
üîß Retrieve remote backup configuration for an Odoo instance

**What this does:**
- Returns current remote backup settings (S3/SFTP)
- Shows enabled/disabled status and configuration details
- Includes retention and encryption settings

**Use cases:**
- Check current remote backup setup
- Verify configuration before updates
- Troubleshoot remote backup issues

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance
parameters.name: user

get.description:
üîß List all remote backup configurations (global and user-scoped)

**What this does:**
- Returns all global and user-scoped remote backup configurations
- Shows configuration hierarchy and inheritance
- Provides overview of backup policy across the system

**Use cases:**
- Audit remote backup configurations
- Understand backup policy across users
- Plan backup strategy changes

200.description: Successfully retrieved all remote backup configurations

post.description:
üîÑ Restore an Odoo instance from a backup file

**What this does:**
- Restores a complete Odoo instance from a backup file
- Replaces current database and filestore with backup data
- Can restore to a new database name if specified
- Validates backup integrity before restoration

**Restore options:**
- Overwrite: Replaces existing instance completely
- New database: Creates new instance with different name
- Selective: Restore only specific components

**Use cases:**
- Disaster recovery
- Testing with production data
- Data migration between servers
- Rollback after failed upgrades

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** This will overwrite existing data - ensure you have a backup

get.description:
üìÖ Retrieve all backup schedules and their configurations

**What this does:**
- Lists all configured backup schedules across all instances
- Shows schedule details including frequency, retention, and status
- Provides backup statistics and scheduler health information
- Supports filtering by user and/or website

**Schedule information includes:**
- Frequency: How often backups are created
- Retention: How many backups to keep
- Status: Whether the schedule is active
- Last/Next run: Execution timing information
- Backup statistics: Count and total size

**Use cases:**
- Backup schedule monitoring
- Capacity planning
- Compliance auditing
- System health monitoring
‚è∞ List all backup schedules and configurations

**What this does:**
- Lists all configured backup schedules across all users and instances
- Shows detailed information about each scheduled backup job
- Displays backup statistics and configuration settings
- Supports filtering by user and/or website

**Schedule information includes:**
- User and website identification
- Backup frequency and retention settings
- Job status (running/stopped) and timing
- Last and next run times
- Backup count and total storage usage
- Configuration details and metadata

**Filter options:**
- No parameters: Returns all schedules for all users
- User only: Returns all schedules for that user
- User + Website: Returns schedule for that specific instance

**Use cases:**
- Backup schedule management
- System monitoring and health checks
- Capacity planning and optimization
- Compliance and audit reporting

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Schedules are managed by the Go-native scheduler

parameters.description: Website/instance name to filter schedules (e.g., 'mycompany.com') - requires user parameter
parameters.name: website

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance (e.g., 'myuser')
parameters.name: user

post.description:
‚è∞ Create a new automated backup schedule

**What this does:**
- Creates a new automated backup schedule for the specified instance
- Sets up cron job to run backups at specified intervals
- Configures backup retention and storage settings
- Validates schedule parameters before creation

**Schedule options:**
- Frequency: Daily, weekly, monthly, or custom cron expression
- Retention: Number of backups to keep (older ones are deleted)
- Immediate: Whether to create first backup immediately
- Notification: Email alerts for backup status

**Use cases:**
- Automated backup setup
- Disaster recovery planning
- Compliance requirements
- System maintenance automation

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Existing schedules for the same instance will be updated

delete.description:
üóëÔ∏è Remove an automated backup schedule

**What this does:**
- Removes the automated backup schedule for the specified instance
- Deletes the associated cron job from the system
- Stops future automated backups for this instance
- Preserves existing backup files (does not delete backups)

**Deletion process:**
- Removes cron job entry from system scheduler
- Cleans up backup configuration files
- Stops automated backup execution
- Maintains existing backup history

**What happens after deletion:**
- No new automated backups will be created
- Existing backup files remain untouched
- Manual backups can still be created
- Schedule can be recreated later if needed

**Use cases:**
- Discontinue automated backups for decommissioned instances
- Switch to manual backup strategy
- Temporary suspension of automated backups
- System maintenance and cleanup

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** This will stop automated backups - ensure you have a backup strategy

get.description:
‚öôÔ∏è Get the current status of the backup scheduler system

**What this does:**
- Provides real-time status of the backup scheduler service
- Shows active jobs, scheduler health, and system status
- Displays configuration and operational metrics
- Monitors scheduler performance and resource usage

**Status information includes:**
- Scheduler service status (running/stopped)
- Total number of active backup jobs
- Job execution statistics and success rates
- System resource usage (CPU, memory)
- Error logs and troubleshooting information
- Configuration status and health checks

**Scheduler metrics:**
- Active job count and queue status
- Last execution times and durations
- Error rates and failure counts
- System uptime and reliability metrics
- Resource consumption patterns

**Use cases:**
- Scheduler health monitoring
- Performance optimization
- Troubleshooting scheduler issues
- Capacity planning and scaling
- System maintenance planning

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Status reflects current system state and may change frequently

put.description:
‚è∞ Update an existing automated backup schedule

**What this does:**
- Updates an existing automated backup schedule for the specified instance
- Modifies cron job frequency, retention settings, and other parameters
- Reconfigures the backup system without losing existing backups
- Validates new schedule parameters before applying changes

**Updateable parameters:**
- Frequency: Change backup frequency (daily, weekly, monthly, custom cron)
- Retention: Modify number of backups to keep
- Timing: Adjust backup execution time
- Notification: Update alert settings

**Update process:**
- Validates new configuration parameters
- Updates backup configuration file
- Reconfigures cron job with new settings
- Preserves existing backup history

**Use cases:**
- Adjust backup frequency based on data changes
- Modify retention policy for storage optimization
- Update backup timing to avoid peak hours
- Change notification preferences

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Changes take effect immediately for new backups

get.description:
üìä Get comprehensive backup summary for an Odoo instance

**What this does:**
- Provides a comprehensive summary of backup status for a specific instance
- Shows backup statistics, storage usage, and schedule information
- Displays recent backup history and success rates
- Includes storage space analysis and backup health metrics

**Summary information includes:**
- Total number of backups and their sizes
- Backup frequency and schedule status
- Last backup date and success status
- Storage space usage and available capacity
- Backup retention policy and cleanup status
- Error history and troubleshooting information

**Metrics provided:**
- Backup count and total size
- Average backup size and duration
- Success/failure rates
- Storage efficiency metrics
- Schedule compliance status

**Use cases:**
- Backup health monitoring
- Storage capacity planning
- Backup policy optimization
- Compliance reporting
- Troubleshooting backup issues

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Summary is based on current backup directory contents

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance
parameters.name: user

404.description: Instance or backup directory not found

post.description:
üîß Test the connection to remote backup storage

**What this does:**
- Tests connectivity to S3 bucket or SFTP server
- Validates credentials and permissions
- Creates a test file to verify write access
- Removes the test file after verification

**Use cases:**
- Verify remote backup configuration
- Troubleshoot connection issues
- Test before enabling remote backups

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance
parameters.name: user

post.description:
ü§ñ Have a natural conversation with the AI assistant to manage your Odoo instances

**What you can do:**
- Ask the AI to create, start, stop, or manage Odoo instances
- Install and manage Odoo addons/modules
- Create and restore backups
- Analyze logs for errors and get solutions
- Execute complex multi-step workflows (pipelines)
- Use natural language - just talk like you would to a person
- The AI understands context and can handle various ways of expressing requests
- Get intelligent responses and automatic action execution

**How to chat:**
- Be conversational: "Can you create a new Odoo instance for me?"
- Be specific: "Create an instance for user john with website example.com"
- Be flexible: "Make me a test instance with any settings"
- Ask questions: "What instances do I have running?"
- Give commands: "Start the instance for john and example.com"

**The AI understands:**
- Different ways of saying the same thing
- Context and implied information
- Natural variations in language
- Flexible parameter formats
- Complex multi-step workflows (pipelines)
- Addon installation and management
- Backup creation and restoration
- Log analysis and error detection

**Example conversations:**
- "Hey, can you set up a new Odoo instance for my company?"
- "I need to start the instance for john and example.com"
- "Can you show me all my running instances?"
- "Create a test instance with any odoo version"
- "Stop the instance for user john"
- "What instances do I have?"
- "Clone the instance for john and example.com"
- "Install sales module for john-example.com"
- "Create a backup for my instance"
- "Analyze logs for errors in john-example.com"
- "Set up complete pipeline: create instance, install modules, create backup, analyze logs"

get.description:
ü§ñ Check if the AI assistant is ready to help you

**What you'll get:**
- Whether the AI is active and ready to chat
- What the AI can help you with
- Current capabilities and features

**Use this to:**
- Verify the AI is working properly
- See what you can ask the AI to do
- Check if everything is configured correctly

post.description:
ü§ñ Test if the AI assistant can understand and respond to you

**What this does:**
- Sends a test message to the AI
- Checks if the AI can process and respond
- Verifies everything is working properly

**Use this when:**
- You want to make sure the AI is working
- You're having trouble with responses
- You want to test the connection

üåê Add a new domain to an Odoo instance.

**What this does:**
- Configures a new domain in the proxy manager (Traefik/Nginx)
- Links the domain to the specified Odoo instance
- Sets up proxy routing to the instance's HTTP/longpolling ports
- Optionally enables SSL if supported by the proxy

**Required fields:**
- `user`: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance (required)
- `website`: Website/instance name (required)
- `domain`: Domain name to add (required)

**Example payload:**
{
"user": "myuser",
"website": "mycompany.com",
"domain": "erp.mycompany.com"
}

**Use cases:**
- Add a new public domain for an Odoo instance
- Enable SSL for a new domain
- Set up custom subdomains for clients

400.description: Invalid domain format or missing parameters

500.description: Proxy configuration failed or system error

delete.description:
üåê Remove a domain from an Odoo instance.

**What this does:**
- Removes the domain configuration from the proxy manager (Traefik/Nginx)
- Unlinks the domain from the specified Odoo instance
- The domain will no longer be accessible through the proxy

**Required fields:**
- `user`: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance (required)
- `website`: Website/instance name (required)
- `domain`: Domain name to remove (required)

**Example payload:**
{
"user": "myuser",
"website": "mycompany.com",
"domain": "erp.mycompany.com"
}

**Use cases:**
- Remove a public domain from an Odoo instance
- Unlink a subdomain no longer in use
- Clean up proxy configuration after client offboarding

400.description: Invalid parameters or instance not found

403.description: Forbidden - Domain not linked to instance

500.description: Proxy configuration failed or system error

get.description:
üåê Retrieve all domains configured for Odoo instances.

**What this does:**
- Lists all proxy domains and their associated Odoo instance information
- Shows upstream ports, longpolling ports, and proxy host details
- Optionally filter by user and website to get domains for specific instances
- Useful for auditing, troubleshooting, and verifying domain routing

**Use cases:**
- Audit all domains in the system
- Find which domains are linked to which Odoo instances
- Troubleshoot proxy routing issues
- Validate SSL and upstream configuration

**Returned fields:**
- `domain`: The public domain name (e.g., "app.mycompany.com")
- `upstream_port`: Odoo HTTP port (e.g., 8069)
- `longpolling_port`: Odoo longpolling port (e.g., 8072)
- `upstream_host`: Host/IP for upstream (usually 127.0.0.1)
- `instance_user`: Linux user for the instance
- `instance_website`: Website/instance name
- `ssl_enabled`: Whether SSL is enabled for this domain

500.description: Internal server error (proxy or config issue)

post.description:
Authenticates with GitHub using a personal access token for the specified user. This enables private repository access and enhanced API limits.

**What this does:**
- Stores a GitHub personal access token for the user
- Enables access to private repositories
- Increases GitHub API rate limits
- Enables authenticated repository operations

**Use cases:**
- Accessing private GitHub repositories
- Increasing API rate limits
- Enhanced repository operations
- Multi-user GitHub integration

**Security Note:** Store tokens securely and use minimal required permissions

400.description: Invalid request body or missing required fields

post.description:
Removes the GitHub authentication token for the specified user, effectively logging out from GitHub integration.

**What this does:**
- Removes the stored GitHub token for the user
- Disables private repository access
- Resets to public repository limits
- Clears GitHub authentication state

**Use cases:**
- Logging out from GitHub integration
- Token rotation and security
- User account cleanup
- Authentication reset

parameters.description: Linux username to logout from GitHub
parameters.name: name

post.description:
Clones and configures a new GitHub repository for the specified Odoo instance. The repository will be available as an addon in the instance.

**What this does:**
- Clones the specified GitHub repository to the instance
- Configures the repository as an Odoo addon
- Sets up the specified branch for tracking
- Integrates with the instance's addon path

**Use cases:**
- Installing custom addons from GitHub
- Adding third-party modules
- Development workflow setup
- Addon deployment

400.description: Invalid request body or missing required fields

500.description: Internal server error - Repository addition failed

delete.description:
Removes a GitHub repository from the specified Odoo instance. This will delete the repository files and remove it from the addon configuration.

**What this does:**
- Removes the repository files from the instance
- Deletes the repository from the github-addons directory
- Removes the addon from Odoo's addon path
- Cleans up any associated configurations

**Use cases:**
- Removing unused or deprecated addons
- Cleaning up development repositories
- Addon replacement and cleanup
- System maintenance

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** This action is permanent and cannot be undone

400.description: Invalid request body or missing required fields

500.description: Internal server error - Repository deletion failed

get.description:
Retrieves a list of all GitHub repositories configured for the specified Odoo instance. Shows repository details including current commit, latest commit, and sync status.

**What this does:**
- Lists all GitHub repositories in the instance's github-addons directory
- Shows current and latest commit information
- Displays how many commits behind the repository is
- Shows last update timestamp and branch information

**Use cases:**
- Repository management and monitoring
- Sync status checking
- Development workflow oversight
- Addon version tracking

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance
parameters.name: name

500.description: Internal server error - Failed to retrieve repositories

get.description:
Retrieves the current GitHub authentication status for the specified user, including token validity and available features.

**What this does:**
- Checks if a GitHub token is configured for the user
- Validates token authenticity and permissions
- Shows available GitHub features and limits
- Provides authentication status information

**Use cases:**
- Checking GitHub integration status
- Token validation and troubleshooting
- Feature availability verification
- Authentication monitoring

parameters.description: Linux username to check GitHub status for
parameters.name: name

500.description: Internal server error - Status check failed

post.description:
Processes GitHub webhook events for automatic repository synchronization. Supports push, pull request, and other GitHub events.

**What this does:**
- Receives and validates GitHub webhook payloads
- Verifies webhook signatures for security
- Processes different event types (push, pull_request, etc.)
- Triggers automatic repository synchronization

**Use cases:**
- Automatic addon updates on code changes
- Continuous deployment workflows
- Development workflow automation
- Repository monitoring and alerts

**Security Note:** Webhook signatures are verified to ensure authenticity

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance
parameters.name: name

400.description: Invalid webhook payload or missing parameters

401.description: Invalid webhook signature or missing secret

500.description: Internal server error - Webhook processing failed

post.description:
Configures a webhook secret for a specific repository to enable secure webhook processing.

**What this does:**
- Stores a webhook secret for the specified repository
- Enables signature verification for incoming webhooks
- Ensures webhook authenticity and security
- Associates the secret with the user/website/repo combination

**Use cases:**
- Setting up secure webhook endpoints
- Repository-specific webhook configuration
- Security hardening for webhook processing
- Multi-repository webhook management

**Security Note:** Use strong, unique secrets for each repository

400.description: Invalid request body or missing required fields

500.description: Internal server error - Secret configuration failed

delete.description:
Removes the webhook secret for a specific repository, disabling webhook processing for that repository.

**What this does:**
- Removes the stored webhook secret for the repository
- Disables webhook signature verification
- Stops webhook processing for the repository
- Cleans up webhook configuration

**Use cases:**
- Disabling webhook processing for a repository
- Repository decommissioning
- Security policy changes
- Webhook configuration cleanup

400.description: Invalid request body or missing required fields

500.description: Internal server error - Secret deletion failed

get.description:
üè¢ Retrieve all Odoo instances with their configurations and status

**What this does:**
- Lists all Odoo instances from the services.json configuration
- Shows instance status (active, inactive, installing, cloning)
- Displays configuration details including ports and versions
- Provides real-time systemd service status

**Instance information includes:**
- User and website identifiers
- Odoo version and configuration
- Port assignments (HTTP and longpolling)
- Systemd service status
- Installation/update status

**Use cases:**
- Instance inventory management
- System health monitoring
- Capacity planning
- Maintenance scheduling

post.description:
üöÄ Install a new Odoo instance with specified configuration

**What this does:**
- Initiates the installation of a new Odoo instance
- Downloads and configures Odoo source code
- Sets up virtual environment and dependencies
- Configures systemd service for automatic startup
- Runs installation asynchronously in background

**Installation process:**
- Downloads Odoo source from specified repository
- Creates Python virtual environment
- Installs Python dependencies
- Configures Odoo settings and database
- Sets up SSL certificates and proxy configuration

**Use cases:**
- New client instance setup
- Development environment creation
- Testing environment setup
- Production instance deployment

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Installation runs in background - check status endpoint for progress

delete.description:
üóëÔ∏è Permanently remove an Odoo instance and its data

**What this does:**
- Completely removes the specified Odoo instance
- Stops and disables the systemd service
- Deletes instance files and directories
- Optionally preserves the database
- Removes proxy configurations and SSL certificates

**Deletion options:**
- Complete removal: Deletes everything including database
- Keep database: Preserves database for potential recovery
- Clean removal: Removes all associated files and configurations

**Use cases:**
- Client termination
- Instance cleanup
- System maintenance
- Storage optimization

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** This action is permanent and cannot be undone

post.description:
‚öôÔ∏è Control Odoo instance systemd services (start, stop, restart, etc.)

**What this does:**
- Controls the systemd service for a specific Odoo instance
- Supports start, stop, restart, enable, disable, and status actions
- Provides detailed service status information including resource usage
- Validates service existence before performing actions

**Supported actions:**
- `start`: Start the service if not running
- `stop`: Stop the service gracefully
- `restart`: Restart the service (stop then start)
- `enable`: Enable service to start on boot
- `disable`: Disable service from starting on boot
- `status`: Get detailed service status and metrics

**Status information includes:**
- Service state (active, inactive, failed)
- Process ID (PID) and uptime
- Memory and CPU usage
- Auto-start configuration
- Load state and error information

**Use cases:**
- Service maintenance and troubleshooting
- Performance monitoring
- System administration
- Emergency service control

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Service actions require appropriate system permissions

üß¨ Create a new instance by cloning an existing one

**What this does:**
- Creates a complete copy of an existing Odoo instance
- Duplicates configuration, addons, and customizations
- Optionally includes GitHub addons and custom modules
- Sets up new systemd service and proxy configuration
- Assigns new ports and database name

**Cloning options:**
- Full clone: Copies everything including data
- Structure only: Copies configuration without data
- Selective: Choose which components to include
- Custom addons: Include GitHub and custom modules

**Use cases:**
- Development environment setup
- Testing with production configuration
- Client staging environment
- Backup instance creation

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Cloning large instances may take significant time

put.description:
‚öôÔ∏è Update Odoo instance configuration file with new settings

**What this does:**
- Updates the configuration file for a specific Odoo instance
- Replaces the entire configuration content
- Validates service and configuration file existence
- Applies changes immediately to the file system

**Configuration updates include:**
- Database connection parameters
- Network and port settings
- Addon and module configurations
- Logging and debugging options
- Security and authentication settings

**Important considerations:**
- Configuration changes may require service restart
- Backup existing configuration before updates
- Validate configuration syntax before applying
- Test changes in development environment first

**Common update scenarios:**
- Database connection changes
- Port number modifications
- Addon path updates
- Log level adjustments
- Security parameter updates

**Use cases:**
- Environment-specific configurations
- Performance tuning
- Security hardening
- Feature enablement/disablement

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** Invalid configurations may break the service

404.description: Service or configuration file not found

post.description:
‚öôÔ∏è Retrieve Odoo instance configuration file contents

**What this does:**
- Reads the configuration file for a specific Odoo instance
- Returns the complete configuration as text
- Provides access to Odoo settings and parameters
- Validates configuration file existence

**Configuration includes:**
- Database connection settings
- HTTP and longpolling port configurations
- Addon paths and module settings
- Logging and debugging options
- Security and authentication settings

**Common settings:**
- `db_host`, `db_port`, `db_user`, `db_password`
- `http_port`, `longpolling_port`
- `addons_path`, `data_dir`
- `log_level`, `log_handler`
- `admin_passwd`, `secret_key`

**Use cases:**
- Configuration review and validation
- Troubleshooting connection issues
- Security auditing
- Backup and documentation

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Configuration files may contain sensitive information

404.description: Service or configuration file not found

**Use cases:**

- Performance monitoring
- Error investigation
- System health monitoring

post.description:
üóëÔ∏è Clear installation logs for a specific Odoo instance

**What this does:**
- Removes the installation log file for a specific instance
- Frees up disk space by deleting temporary log files
- Validates log file existence before deletion
- Provides confirmation of successful log clearing

**When to use:**
- After successful installation completion
- To free up disk space
- To remove outdated installation logs
- During system cleanup operations

**Important considerations:**
- This action is irreversible
- Only clears installation logs, not runtime logs
- Does not affect the running Odoo instance
- Logs are automatically cleared after successful installations

**Use cases:**
- Post-installation cleanup
- Disk space management
- System maintenance
- Troubleshooting reset

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** This action permanently deletes the log file

delete.description:
üóëÔ∏è Delete a specific log file from the system

**What this does:**
- Removes a specific log file from the logs directory
- Validates file existence before deletion
- Provides confirmation of successful deletion
- Frees up disk space

**Supported log types:**
- Installation logs (`*_temp_installation.log`)
- Application runtime logs
- System service logs
- Error and debug logs
- Backup and maintenance logs

**Important considerations:**
- This action is irreversible
- Only deletes the specified file
- Does not affect running services
- Use with caution for active log files

**Use cases:**
- Clean up old installation logs
- Remove outdated log files
- Free up disk space
- System maintenance
- Log rotation management

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** This action permanently deletes the specified log file

get.description:
üìã Retrieve Odoo instance installation logs for debugging and monitoring

**What this does:**
- Reads the installation log file for a specific Odoo instance

- Provides real-time access to installation status and errors
- Validates log file existence and accessibility

**Installation log information includes:**

- Package installation progress
- Database setup and configuration
- Odoo application installation steps
- Service configuration and startup
- Error messages and troubleshooting info

**Log format:**
- Timestamped installation steps
- Progress indicators and status messages
- Error codes and detailed descriptions
- System command outputs

**Use cases:**
- Monitor installation progress
- Debug installation failures
- Verify installation completion
- Troubleshoot setup issues

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Installation logs are temporary and may be cleared after successful installation

üìÅ List all available log files in the system

**What this does:**
- Scans the logs directory for all available log files

post.description:
üêç Install one or more Python packages in the specified Odoo instance's virtual environment

**What this does:**
- Downloads and installs packages from PyPI (Python Package Index)
- Resolves package dependencies automatically
- Supports version pinning and constraint specifications
- Validates package compatibility with existing environment
- Updates package metadata and installation records

**Package specification formats:**
- `package_name` - Latest available version
- `package_name==version` - Exact version (e.g., `requests==2.31.0`)
- `package_name>=version` - Minimum version (e.g., `requests>=2.30.0`)
- `package_name~=version` - Compatible release (e.g., `requests~=2.31.0`)
- `package_name!=version` - Exclude specific version
- `git+https://github.com/user/repo.git` - Install from Git repository
- `file:///path/to/package.whl` - Install from local wheel file

**Common Odoo addon dependencies:**
- `reportlab==4.0.4` - PDF generation for reports
- `openpyxl==3.1.2` - Excel file processing
- `pandas==2.0.3` - Data analysis and manipulation
- `matplotlib==3.7.2` - Chart and graph generation
- `boto3==1.28.0` - AWS SDK for cloud integrations
- `stripe==6.1.0` - Payment processing integration

**Installation process:**
- Validates virtual environment accessibility
- Checks package availability on PyPI
- Downloads package and dependencies
- Installs packages in isolated environment
- Updates pip cache and metadata

**Use cases:**
- Adding new functionality to Odoo instances
- Installing custom module dependencies
- Adding reporting and analytics tools
- Integrating with external services
- Installing development and debugging tools

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** Some packages may require system-level dependencies

400.description: Invalid package specification or missing required fields

404.description: Virtual environment or package not found

409.description: Package version conflict or already installed

500.description: Installation failed - Network or permission error

get.description:
üêç Retrieve a comprehensive list of all installed Python packages in the specified Odoo instance's virtual environment

**What this does:**
- Scans the virtual environment for all installed Python packages
- Returns packages in standard pip freeze format (package==version)
- Provides package metadata including version information
- Validates virtual environment accessibility and structure

**Package information includes:**
- Package name and exact version
- Installation path within virtual environment
- Package dependencies and requirements
- Installation timestamp and metadata

**Use cases:**
- Package inventory and audit
- Dependency analysis and management
- Version compatibility checking
- Security vulnerability assessment
- Environment replication and backup

**Common packages in Odoo environments:**
- `odoo==17.0.0` - Core Odoo framework
- `psycopg2-binary==2.9.7` - PostgreSQL adapter
- `requests==2.31.0` - HTTP library
- `python-dateutil==2.8.2` - Date utilities
- `Pillow==10.0.0` - Image processing
- `lxml==4.9.3` - XML processing

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Virtual environment must exist and be accessible

parameters.description: Linux username hosting the Odoo instance (e.g., 'myuser', 'john', 'admin')
parameters.name: user

400.description: Invalid request parameters - Missing user or website

delete.description:
üêç Remove one or more Python packages from the specified Odoo instance's virtual environment

**What this does:**
- Completely removes specified packages from the virtual environment
- Uninstalls package dependencies that are no longer needed
- Cleans up package metadata and cache files
- Updates pip's package index and dependency tree
- Removes package files and directories

**Uninstallation process:**
- Validates package existence in environment
- Checks for dependent packages that may be affected
- Removes package files and directories
- Updates pip's internal package database
- Cleans up orphaned dependencies

**Package specification:**
- Use exact package names (without version numbers)
- Case-sensitive package names
- Multiple packages can be uninstalled simultaneously
- Dependencies are automatically handled

**Common packages to uninstall:**
- `requests` - HTTP library (if not needed)
- `pandas` - Data analysis (if not used)
- `matplotlib` - Charting library (if not needed)
- `reportlab` - PDF generation (if not used)
- `openpyxl` - Excel processing (if not needed)
- `boto3` - AWS SDK (if not using cloud services)

**Use cases:**
- Removing unused dependencies
- Cleaning up after module removal
- Reducing virtual environment size
- Resolving package conflicts
- Security cleanup (removing vulnerable packages)
- Performance optimization

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** This action is irreversible and may break dependent functionality
**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Core Odoo packages should not be uninstalled

400.description: Invalid package names or missing required fields

404.description: Virtual environment or package not found

409.description: Package is a dependency of other packages

500.description: Uninstallation failed - Permission or dependency error

put.description:
üêç Upgrade one or more Python packages to their latest available versions in the specified Odoo instance's virtual environment

**What this does:**
- Checks for newer versions of specified packages on PyPI
- Downloads and installs the latest compatible versions
- Maintains dependency compatibility and constraints
- Updates package metadata and installation records
- Preserves existing package configurations and settings

**Upgrade process:**
- Validates current package installations
- Checks PyPI for available updates
- Resolves dependency conflicts and constraints
- Downloads new package versions
- Installs updates while preserving data
- Updates pip cache and package index

**Package specification:**
- Use package names without version numbers
- Multiple packages can be upgraded simultaneously
- Dependencies are automatically upgraded as needed
- Version constraints are respected during upgrade

**Common packages to upgrade:**
- `requests` - HTTP library (security updates)
- `psycopg2-binary` - PostgreSQL adapter (performance)
- `Pillow` - Image processing (security fixes)
- `lxml` - XML processing (security updates)
- `python-dateutil` - Date utilities (bug fixes)
- `reportlab` - PDF generation (new features)

**Upgrade considerations:**
- **Security updates:** Critical for vulnerability patches
- **Bug fixes:** Improves stability and performance
- **New features:** Adds functionality and capabilities
- **Compatibility:** May require testing with custom modules
- **Breaking changes:** Major version updates may break code

**Use cases:**
- Security vulnerability patching
- Performance optimization and bug fixes
- Access to new features and capabilities
- Maintaining package currency and support
- Preparing for Odoo version upgrades
- Compliance with security policies

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** Test upgrades in development environment first
**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Some packages may have breaking changes in major versions

400.description: Invalid package names or missing required fields

404.description: Virtual environment or package not found

409.description: Package version conflict or dependency issue

500.description: Upgrade failed - Network or compatibility error

get.description:
üé≠ Generate a login token for a specific Odoo user. Use this token to log in via the /login_as endpoint.

**What this does:**
- Generates a secure, time-limited impersonation token for the specified Odoo user
- Allows support staff or admins to log in as the user without knowing their password
- Token can be used with the /login_as endpoint to set a valid Odoo session

**Use cases:**
- Support troubleshooting as a specific user
- User experience replication
- Temporary admin access for user accounts

**Security Note:**
- Tokens are short-lived and single-use
- Only available to authorized API clients

- All user data and records are restored
- User permissions and settings remain unchanged

**Use cases:**
- Employee return from leave
- Account reactivation after security review
- Temporary suspension reversal
- User account restoration

Example: "app.mycompany.com", "erp.test.odoo.com"

Linux username hosting the Odoo instance (required)
Example: "myuser", "john", "admin"

Website domain or instance name (required)
Example: "mycompany.com", "test.odoo.com"

secret.description: required for set, not for delete

packages.description:
List of Python packages to operate on (required for install/uninstall/upgrade)
For install: Can include version specifications (e.g., "requests==2.31.0")
For uninstall/upgrade: Use package names only (e.g., "requests")
Example: ["requests==2.31.0", "python-dateutil==2.8.2", "reportlab"]

Linux username hosting the Odoo instance (required)
